title: Best README Template
description: An awesome README template to jumpstart your projects!

variables.label: Logo URL
variables.name: logoURL
variables.defaultValue: https://source.unsplash.com/random/256x256

variables.label: Headline
variables.name: headline
variables.defaultValue: ReadME Generator

variables.label: Catchphrase
variables.name: catchphrase
variables.defaultValue: An awesome README template to jumpstart your projects!

variables.label: Explore The Docs URL
variables.name: exploreTheDocsURL
variables.defaultValue: https://github.com/ShaanCoding/ReadME-Generator/

variables.label: View Demo URL
variables.name: viewDemoURL
variables.defaultValue: https://github.com/ShaanCoding/ReadME-Generator/

variables.label: Report Bug URL
variables.name: reportBugURL
variables.defaultValue: https://github.com/ShaanCoding/ReadME-Generator/issues/new?labels=bug&template=bug-report---.md

variables.label: Request Feature URL
variables.name: requestFeatureURL
variables.defaultValue: https://github.com/ShaanCoding/ReadME-Generator/issues/new?labels=enhancement&template=feature-request---.md

functions.name: About The Project
functions.description: This is the about the project section

variables.label: Description
variables.name: aboutTheProjectDescription
variables.defaultValue:
There are many great README templates available on GitHub; however, I didn't find one that really suited my needs so I created this enhanced one. I want to create a README template so amazing that it'll be the last one you ever need -- I think this is it.

Here's why:

- Your time should be focused on creating something amazing. A project that solves a problem and helps others
- You shouldn't be doing the same tasks over and over like creating a README from scratch
- You should implement DRY principles to the rest of your life :smile:

Of course, no one template will serve all projects since your needs may be different. So I'll be adding more in the near future. You may also suggest changes by forking this repo and creating a pull request or opening an issue. Thanks to all the people have contributed to expanding this template!

Use the `BLANK_README.md` to get started.

functions.name: Built With
functions.description: This is the built with section

variables.label: Description
variables.name: builtWithDescription
variables.defaultValue: This section should list any major frameworks/libraries used to bootstrap your project. Leave any add-ons/plugins for the acknowledgements section. Here are a few examples.

functions.name: Getting Started
functions.description: This is the getting started section

variables.label: Description
variables.name: gettingStartedDescription
variables.defaultValue:
This is an example of how you may give instructions on setting up your project locally.
To get a local copy up and running follow these simple example steps.

variables.label: Prerequisites Description
variables.name: prerequisitesDescription
variables.defaultValue:
This is an example of how to list things you need to use the software and how to install them.

- npm
  ```sh
  npm install npm@latest -g
  ```

variables.label: Installation Description
variables.name: installationDescription
variables.defaultValue:
_Below is an example of how you can instruct your audience on installing and setting up your app. This template doesn't rely on any external dependencies or services._

1. Get a free API Key at [https://example.com](https://example.com)
2. Clone the repo
   ```sh
   git clone https://github.com/your_username_/Project-Name.git
   ```
3. Install NPM packages
   ```sh
   npm install
   ```
4. Enter your API in `config.js`
   ```js
   const API_KEY = "ENTER YOUR API";
   ```

variables.label: Usage Description
variables.name: usageDescription
variables.defaultValue:
Use this space to show useful examples of how a project can be used. Additional screenshots, code examples and demos work well in this space. You may also link to more resources.

_For more examples, please refer to the [Documentation](https://example.com)_

variables.label: Roadmap Description
variables.name: roadmapDescription
variables.defaultValue:
- [x] Add Changelog
- [x] Add back to top links
- [ ] Add Additional Templates w/ Examples
- [ ] Add "components" document to easily copy & paste sections of the readme
- [ ] Multi-language Support
  - [ ] Chinese
  - [ ] Spanish

variables.label: Open Issues URL
variables.name: openIssuesURL
variables.defaultValue: https://github.com/ShaanCoding/ReadME-Generator/issues

variables.label: Contributing Description
variables.name: contributingDescription
variables.defaultValue:
Contributions are what make the open source community such an amazing place to learn, inspire, and create. Any contributions you make are **greatly appreciated**.

If you have a suggestion that would make this better, please fork the repo and create a pull request. You can also simply open an issue with the tag "enhancement".
Don't forget to give the project a star! Thanks again!

1. Fork the Project
2. Create your Feature Branch (`git checkout -b feature/AmazingFeature`)
3. Commit your Changes (`git commit -m 'Add some AmazingFeature'`)
4. Push to the Branch (`git push origin feature/AmazingFeature`)
5. Open a Pull Request

variables.label: License Name
variables.name: licenseName
variables.defaultValue: MIT

variables.label: License URL
variables.name: licenseURL_url
variables.defaultValue: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT

variables.label: Contact Description
variables.name: contactDescription
variables.defaultValue:
Your Name - [@your_twitter](https://twitter.com/your_username) - email@example.com

Project Link: [https://github.com/your_username/repo_name](https://github.com/your_username/repo_name)

variables.label: Acknowledgments Description
variables.name: acknowledgmentsDescription
variables.defaultValue: Use this space to list resources you find helpful and would like to give credit to. I've included a few of my favorites to kick things off!
